answer:
Sure, here is the answer to the question:

Carl Linnaeus was born in Sweden in 1707 and died in Sweden in 1778. He is considered one of the greatest taxonomists of all time and is known for developing the binomial nomenclature system. His work, Systema Naturae, is a foundational text in the field of systematic botany. Linnaeus was born into a wealthy Swedish noble family and lived a comfortable life.
